page.title: 10FLOWERS
page.content: There are abundant wild flowers including primrose, cowslip, bluebell,ragged robin, wild arum,violet,wood anemone & many of the clover family which particularly like limey soils. There are few hay meadows left,silage being preferred,but where patches of grass are left undisturbed there are harebells,dog daisies,yellow rattle & a great variety of grasses. In small protected areas within the limeyards can be found a variety of orchids, including twayblade & blue gentian. Hart's tongue fern grows there in abundance.
